subject: Productivity
title: The ONE Thing
description: A fast breakdown of The ONE Thing for builders.

hook.text: Gary Keller built the world's largest real estate company by asking one question every morning.

buildup.text: What's the ONE thing I can do such that by doing it everything else becomes easier or unnecessary?

discovery.text: The question forces a single priority. No splitting focus. No top-three lists. One thing, above all others.

twist.text: Multitasking research shows that switching between tasks costs 28% of a productive day. One thing eliminates the tax.

climax.text: The domino effect: one priority knocks the next into place. Sequential focus beats parallel effort.

punchline.text: One thing at a time. In the right order. That's enough.

quiz.question: How much productivity does task-switching cost according to research?
